security: The document discusses concerns about acknowledging the CIA's affiliation with Camp Perry, stating that 'Mr. Phillips' comments as a former senior Agency officer can be interpreted as constituting official acknowledgement of the CIA/CAMP PERRY relationship'. Revealing the location of covert agency training facilities would compromise security.
summary: This record sheet outlines the review process for a manuscript submitted by former CIA employee David A. Phillips to determine if it contains classified information or material not in the public domain. It highlights a specific concern regarding the potential identification of Camp Perry as a CIA training site.
summary_one_paragraph: J.F. Meehan from C/EAB is coordinating a review of a manuscript submitted by retired CIA employee David A. Phillips, focusing on three chapters of a book he is preparing. The review, involving LA Div., CI Staff, CCS, DDO/SS/SOG, and DDO/SSU, aims to determine if the manuscript contains classified information, information learned during Phillips' employment, or information not already in the public domain. A key point of concern is Phillips' potential confirmation of Camp Perry as a CIA training installation, which CCS recommends be deleted to avoid official acknowledgment of the site's CIA affiliation.
title: Review for Approval - Manuscript Submitted by Mr. David A. Phillips
recipient: GH-44, Att: Mr. H. Schor C/LA Div.
